description.text: A single power-generating module and/or demand unit, Its energy flexibility is modelled by EFDM
The Submodel Energy Flexibility Data Model (EFDM) provides a unified framework for describing energy flexibility
The flexibleLoadMeasuresPackage contains one or more Flexible-Load Measures that describe a specific change in the performance of a dedicated Flexible Load
The metadata provides essential information for tracking and tracing of the model instances.
The ID of a Flexibility Space or Flexible-Load Measure Package for unique identification
Free text to comment the EFDM object.
Specification of the EFDM version and hyperlink to the corresponding scheme.
the EFDM version (e.g. 0.3)
hyperlink to the corresponding scheme

Containing UUID of the creating service and point in time of creation. By means of the automated filling in of the Element, conclusions about the origin and an allocation to executing agencies are made possible. In the case of communication with external services, this Element is replaced by an ID that is intended for external communication.
UUID of the creating service and point in time of creation
timestamp of the creating service

Containing UUID of the service instance that last processed this object and point in time of last processing. In the case of communication with external services, this Element can be replaced by an ID that is intended for external communication.
UUID of the service instance that last processed this object
timestamp of of last processing
Its value should be provided by service provider, who creates SMC flexibilitySpace of the EFDM instance
flexibleLoadMeasuresmay contain multiple flexibleLoadMeasure.

Each flexibleLoadMeasure describes a specific load change profile of a dedicated Flexible Load within an Flexibility Space. In addition, the revenue resulting from the execution of the flexibleLoadMeasure is specified in this class.

The ID of the load measure for unique identification. The Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) is generated automatically and is used for identification and assignment within an IT system in a company and for further processing by external, market-side services.

enum: draft, toExecute, inExecution, executed, partiallyExecuted, failed, canceled. The status of a Flexible-Load Measure indicates its current progress within the process of providing energy flexiblity. The goal is to enable clear tracking of each measure across defined phases.
The ID of the Flexible Load to which the Flexible-Load Measure is directed.
Total revenue received by a company for executing the Flexible-Load Measure.
loadChangeProfiles may contain multiple loadChangeProfile.
Load profile that represents the power reduction or increase of the Flexible Load.

Positive power states mean that the Flexible-Load Measure requests an increase in power consumption from the Flexible Load. Negative power states require a decrease in power consumption. Interpolation between Power States is linear; a step change in power can be mapped by specifying two equal timestamps with different power values.
timestamp of a power state

This SMC describes the degrees of freedom of an energy-flexible system within its actual operational environment. It includes all relevant conditions, resources, and constraints of the production context, enabling a realistic representation of the maximum feasible flexibility potential, regardless of a specific application.
The metadata provides essential information for tracking and tracing of the model instances.
The ID of a Flexibility Space or Flexible-Load Measure Package for unique identification
Free text to comment the EFDM object.
Specification of the EFDM version and hyperlink to the corresponding scheme.
the EFDM version (e.g. 0.3)
hyperlink to the corresponding scheme

Containing UUID of the creating service and point in time of creation. By means of the automated filling in of the Element, conclusions about the origin and an allocation to executing agencies are made possible. In the case of communication with external services, this Element is replaced by an ID that is intended for external communication.
UUID of the creating service and point in time of creation
timestamp of the creating service

Containing UUID of the service instance that last processed this object and point in time of last processing. In the case of communication with external services, this Element can be replaced by an ID that is intended for external communication.
UUID of the service instance that last processed this object
timestamp of of last processing
Containing metainformation, describing the model status and scope

enum: draft, available, offered, reserved, measuresRequest, finalized. The status of a Flexibility Space describes its current condition within the overall process of applying energy-flexible measures. The objctive is to make the progession and individual phases of each Flexibility Space transparently traceable.

enum: generalTechnicalPotential, operationalPotential, applicationTailoredPotential. The modelling scope places individual EFDM instances and their key figures into context. generalTechnicalPotential: The modelling of flexibility includes universally valid technical characteristics and restrictions; the model does not contain operational strategies, production plans, or other plant-specific limitations. The energy flexibility potential is not directly implementable. operationalPotential: Flexibility is fully considered within the production environment; the model describes the maximum feasible potential, independent of the specific use case. applicationTailoredPotential: The model describes a potential tailored to a specific application (e.g. energy market may allow only Flexible Load with 15-min holding durations); storage and dependencies may need to be transformed to be represented as Flexible Load.
The Trading of a Flexibility Space comprises configurable properties that determine its feasibility and operational implementation
Indicates whether the Flexibility Space is intended to participate in external energy markets (true) or is to be used exclusively for internal optimization purposes (false).
Specifies whether the trading process can be executed automatically (true) or if additional manual preparations or reviews and verification procedures are required (false).
flexibleLoads may contain multiple flexibleLoad.

Each flexibleLoad describes the energy flexibility of a technical system (i.e. controllable unit) or a combination of systems (i.e. an ensemble of controllable units) that can adjust its power consumption or generation in response to external conditions or requirements. It focuses on the limitations and possibilities (degrees of freedom) of changing power outputs of a technical system.

The ID of a Flexible Load for unique identification. The Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) is generated automatically and is used for identification and assignment within an IT system in a company and for further processing by external, market-side services. String Format: UUID

Time (seconds) required by a technical system between the receipt of a call-up and the initiation of a Flexible-Load Measure within the enterprise. The call must be issued with at least this lead time before the Flexible-Load Measure starts.

Subset of the company-internal planning horizon in which the Flexible Load is available. The beginning and end of this validity period are specified with the attributes from and until. If this period is not specified, continuous availability of the Flexible Load is assumed.
from time. If this period is not specified, continuous availability of the Flexible Load  is assumed.
until time. If this period is not specified, continuous availability of the Flexible Load  is assumed.

enum: start, total, end. The temporalType start specifies that the start of each Flexible-Load Measure belonging to this Flexible Load must lie within the Validity Period. end specifies that the end of each Flexible-Load Measure belonging to this Flexible Load must lie within the Validity Period. total specifies that the total duration of each Flexible-Load Measure belonging to this Flexible Load must lie within the Validity Period.
a set of Power States with which the Flexible Load can run during each of the (number of changes + 1) holding periods.
A power state with which the Flexible Load can run during the corresponding holding periods.

A positive sign means that the Flexible Load can increase its power consumption. Negative Power States represent a possible decrease in power consumption. Uncertainty can be represented by specifying a range.
The time period during which the Flexible Load can run in its corresponding Power States. Uncertainty can be represented by specifying a range.
the scheduled baseline load

enum: deliveryDuration, holdingDuration. Duration either corresponds to the time of a constant Power State (holdingDuration) OR a constant Power State WITH initial power modulation (deliveryDuration).

The permitted number of activations of the Flexible Load within the Validity Period. A specified minimum value of the range defines a required number of activations; a specified maximum value sets an upper limit on activation frequency.

The maximum number of Power State changes (modulations) allowed within one use of a Flexible Load. The two modulations corresponding to the initial activation and the final deactivation are not counted.
The absolute value of the power gradient of a Flexible Load indicates how fast the power can be increased or decreased.
Actication Gradient specifies the power gradient applicable during the initial activation of the Flexibl Load.
Modulation Gradient specifies the power gradient during transitions between Power States.
Deactivation Gradient specifies the power gradient during the final deactivation phase

The required regeneration time during which no other measure of the same Flexible Load may be activated following the deactivation of a previous measure. This time constraint applies only if an actual deactivation occurs. If another measure follows without interruption, no deactivation takes place between them; this does not constitute a violation of the defined regerneration period.
The costs associated with the use of the Flexible Load, excluding electricity costs. The Costs of a Flexible Load consist of variable cost, usage cost and fixed cost.
Variable costs refer to the total amount of energy converted.
Usage costs are incurred per use of a Flexible-Load.
Fixed costs incurred during the Validity Period regardless of the call of a Flexible Load (example: standby costs of a power generation plant).

Latest possible time by which confirmation of an accepted offer of the Flexible Load must have been received. By this time, the flexibility provider needs to know whether the Flexible Load must be held ready. After the Booking Confirmation Deadline is exceeded, the Flexible Load offer is removed from the market. The Order Confirmation Deadline can be specified EITHER absolutely with a fixed time OR relative to the start time of the Flexible-Load Measure (e.g. 100 seconds before the start of a FLM). If no value is specified, constant availability for offering is assumed until the latest possible start time within the Validity Period minus the Reaction Duration.
absolute deadline
relative to the start time of the Flexible-Load Measure (e.g. 100 seconds before the start of a FLM)

Prices to be realized on the market as a minimum for offering the Flexible Load. The Prices of a Flexible Load are composed of a variable price, a usage price and a fixed price analogous to the Costs. Prices are only needed if the Flexible Load is to be actively offered on the market.
Variable price refer to the total amount of energy converted.
Usage price are incurred per use of a Flexible-Load.
Fixed price
Meter point designation for the geographical and power grid topological location of a Flexible Load.
The unambiguous allocation is made by means of the meter point designation known in the energy industry / in market communication. In Germany, it corresponds to a 33-digit alphanumeric code number.

The specification of the Grid Voltage Level to which the Flexible Load is connected. The voltage level at the grid connection point is to be used, independent of deviating voltage levels in any company grid.
Storages may contain multiple storages, each of which represents a technical system or a combination of systems that has the potential to store energy
A storage represents a technical system or a combination of systems that has the potential to store energy

The ID of a storage for unique identification. The Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) is generated automatically and is used for identification and assignment within an IT system in a company and for further processing by external, market-side services.

The costs associated with the use of the energy storage. The Costs of a storage facility consist of variable cost, usage cost and fixed cost. Variable costs refer to the total amount of energy converted. Usage costs arise per use of a storage tank. Fixed costs arise from keeping a storage facility on standby.
Variable costs refer to the total amount of energy converted.
Usage costs arise per use of a storage tank.
Fixed costs arise from keeping a storage facility on standby.

Lower and upper limit of the storage energy content. These limits must never be exceeded or fallen short of. Depending on the choice of reference point, it is also possible to specify negative storage capacities, e.g. if it needs to be possible to either exceed or fall below storage limits.

Energy content of the storage at the start time of the Validity Period of the associated Flexible Load (Suppliers). If the storage is connected to several Flexible Loads, the Initial Energy Content refers to the earliest start time of the Validity Periods of all Flexible Loads. If the initial energy content cannot be quantified exactly, the predicted range can be specified via min and max.

Energy content that the storage must have at the end time of the Validity Period of the associated Flexible Loads (Suppliers). If the storage is connected to several Flexible Loads, the Target Energy Content refers to the latest end time of the Validity Periods of all Flexible Loads. If the target energy content is flexible, the desired target range is specified can be specified via min and max.
Proportion of the energy content that is continuously lost, e.g. through exchange with the environment. The percentage refers to the actual energy content and not to the storage capacity.
One or more Flexible Loads supplying the storage. The Flexible Loads must be defined in the same Flexibility Space. The conversion efficiency is specified for each supply system.
Indicating a single supply

This ID identifies the Flexible Load supplying the storage. The ID of a Flexible Load for unique identification. The Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) is generated automatically and is used for identification and assignment within an IT system in a company and for further processing by external, market-side services.
Energy conversion efficiency of the suppiler
Non-influenceable energy demands in the form of a load profile that must be met. The interpolation between the Power States is linear.
Indicating a single non-influenceable energy demand
power drained
timestamp of power drain

dependenciesmay contain multiple dependencies, each of which can be used to describe a restriction or dependency for the interaction of several Flexible Loads within an Flexibility Space. This allows the permissible operating options of an overall system to be mapped in greater detail so that Flexible-Load Measures do not have a negative impact on the system, the production processes or the product quality.

Each dependency can be used to describe a restriction or dependency for the interaction of several Flexible Loads within an Flexibility Space. This allows the permissible operating options of an overall system to be mapped in greater detail so that Flexible-Load Measures do not have a negative impact on the system, the production processes or the product quality.
The ID of a dependency for unique identification.

The time period following the activation of theTriggering Flexible-Load during which the Target Flexible-Load must be activated at least once (Logical Type: implies) or must not be activated at all (Logical Type: excludes). The values specified for min and max define the Applicability duration relative to:

Additional conditions that must be met for the dependency to be considered fulfilled. In other words, an activation of the Triggering Flexible-Load implies or excludes a corresponding activation of the Target Flexible-Load in a configuration (measure), so that the applicability conditions are fulfilled. The Triggering Flexible-Load metrics are incorporated on the left side of the formula. The Target Flexible-Load metrics are incorporated on the right side.
Indicating a single condition
enum: equals, less, lessEqual, greater, greaterEqual.
The Target Flexible-Load metrics are incorporated on the right side.
The Triggering Flexible-Load metrics are incorporated on the left side of the formula.

The Flexible Load that triggers the dependency. The Flexible Load must be defined in the same Flexibility Space, and is referenced by its ID. In addition, one time parameter (start, total or end) of the Triggering Flexible-Load affected by the dependency is to be indicated.

enum: start, total, end. The temporalType start specifies that with the activation of a Flexible-Load Measure belonging to this Flexible Load, the dependency Applicability Duration" of the Target Flexible-Load begins.  end specifies that at the deactivation end of a Flexible-Load Measure belonging to this Flexible Load, the dependency Appicability Duration of the "Target Flexible-Load begins.  total specifies that during a Flexible-Load Measure belonging to this Flexible Load, the dependency Applicability Duration of the Target Flexible-Load is valid.
The ID of the Flexible Load that is affected by the Triggering Flexible-Load. The Flexible Load must be defined in the same Flexibility Space, and is referenced by its ID.
target flexible load

enum: start, total, end. The temporalType start specifies that the start of a Flexible-Load Measure of the Target Flexible-Load is affected by the dependency Applicability Duration. end specifies that the deactivation end of a Flexible-Load Measure of the Target Flexible-Load is affected by the dependency Applicability Duration. total specifies that the Flexible-Load Measure of the Target Flexible-Load is affected by the dependency Applicability Duration starting at activation until the end of deactivation
UUID of the Flexible Load that is affected by the Triggering Flexible-Load. The Flexible Load must be defined in the same Flexibility Space, and is referenced by its ID.

enum: implies, excludes. Specifies whether a use of the Triggering Flexible-Load requires (implies) or prevents (excludes) the activation of the Target Flexible-Load within the Applicability Duration.

This SMC describes the degrees of freedom of an energy-flexible system tailored to the requirements and restrictions of a specific application or market. Property values are derived from the operational potential but adjusted to meet the defined application conditions, such as market rules, technical standards, or contractual obligations.
The metadata provides essential information for tracking and tracing of the model instances.
The ID of a Flexibility Space or Flexible-Load Measure Package for unique identification
Free text to comment the EFDM object.
Specification of the EFDM version and hyperlink to the corresponding scheme.
the EFDM version (e.g. 0.3)
hyperlink to the corresponding scheme

The objctive is to make the progession and individual phases of each Flexibility Space transparently traceable.

enum: generalTechnicalPotential, operationalPotential, applicationTailoredPotential. The modelling scope places individual EFDM instances and their key figures into context. generalTechnicalPotential: The modelling of flexibility includes universally valid technical characteristics and restrictions; the model does not contain operational strategies, production plans, or other plant-specific limitations. The energy flexibility potential is not directly implementable. operationalPotential: Flexibility is fully considered within the production environment; the model describes the maximum feasible potential, independent of the specific use case. applicationTailoredPotential: The model describes a potential tailored to a specific application (e.g. energy market may allow only Flexible Load with 15-min holding durations); storage and dependencies may need to be transformed to be represented as Flexible Load.
The Trading of a Flexibility Space comprises configurable properties that determine its feasibility and operational implementation
Indicates whether the Flexibility Space is intended to participate in external energy markets (true) or is to be used exclusively for internal optimization purposes (false).
Specifies whether the trading process can be executed automatically (true) or if additional manual preparations or reviews and verification procedures are required (false).
flexibleLoads may contain multiple flexibleLoad.

Each flexibleLoad describes the energy flexibility of a technical system (i.e. controllable unit) or a combination of systems (i.e. an ensemble of controllable units) that can adjust its power consumption or generation in response to external conditions or requirements. It focuses on the limitations and possibilities (degrees of freedom) of changing power outputs of a technical system.

The ID of a Flexible Load for unique identification. The Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) is generated automatically and is used for identification and assignment within an IT system in a company and for further processing by external, market-side services. String Format: UUID

Time (seconds) required by a technical system between the receipt of a call-up and the initiation of a Flexible-Load Measure within the enterprise. The call must be issued with at least this lead time before the Flexible-Load Measure starts.

Subset of the company-internal planning horizon in which the Flexible Load is available. The beginning and end of this validity period are specified with the attributes from and until. If this period is not specified, continuous availability of the Flexible Load is assumed.
from time. If this period is not specified, continuous availability of the Flexible Load  is assumed.
until time. If this period is not specified, continuous availability of the Flexible Load  is assumed.

enum: start, total, end. The temporalType start specifies that the start of each Flexible-Load Measure belonging to this Flexible Load must lie within the Validity Period. end specifies that the end of each Flexible-Load Measure belonging to this Flexible Load must lie within the Validity Period. total specifies that the total duration of each Flexible-Load Measure belonging to this Flexible Load must lie within the Validity Period.
a set of Power States with which the Flexible Load can run during each of the (number of changes + 1) holding periods.
A power state with which the Flexible Load can run during the corresponding holding periods.

A positive sign means that the Flexible Load can increase its power consumption. Negative Power States represent a possible decrease in power consumption. Uncertainty can be represented by specifying a range.
The time period during which the Flexible Load can run in its corresponding Power States. Uncertainty can be represented by specifying a range.

enum: deliveryDuration, holdingDuration. Duration either corresponds to the time of a constant Power State (holdingDuration) OR a constant Power State WITH initial power modulation (deliveryDuration).
the scheduled baseline load

The permitted number of activations of the Flexible Load within the Validity Period. A specified minimum value of the range defines a required number of activations; a specified maximum value sets an upper limit on activation frequency.

The maximum number of Power State changes (modulations) allowed within one use of a Flexible Load. The two modulations corresponding to the initial activation and the final deactivation are not counted.

Actication Gradient specifies the power gradient applicable during the initial activation of the Flexibl Load.
Modulation Gradient specifies the power gradient during transitions between Power States.

The required regeneration time during which no other measure of the same Flexible Load may be activated following the deactivation of a previous measure. This time constraint applies only if an actual deactivation occurs. If another measure follows without interruption, no deactivation takes place between them; this does not constitute a violation of the defined regerneration period.
The costs associated with the use of the Flexible Load, excluding electricity costs. The Costs of a Flexible Load consist of variable cost, usage cost and fixed cost.
Variable costs refer to the total amount of energy converted.
Usage costs are incurred per use of a Flexible-Load.
Fixed costs incurred during the Validity Period regardless of the call of a Flexible Load (example: standby costs of a power generation plant).

Latest possible time by which confirmation of an accepted offer of the Flexible Load must have been received. By this time, the flexibility provider needs to know whether the Flexible Load must be held ready. After the Booking Confirmation Deadline is exceeded, the Flexible Load offer is removed from the market. The Order Confirmation Deadline can be specified EITHER absolutely with a fixed time OR relative to the start time of the Flexible-Load Measure (e.g. 100 seconds before the start of a FLM). If no value is specified, constant availability for offering is assumed until the latest possible start time within the Validity Period minus the Reaction Duration.
absolute deadline
relative to the start time of the Flexible-Load Measure (e.g. 100 seconds before the start of a FLM)

Prices to be realized on the market as a minimum for offering the Flexible Load. The Prices of a Flexible Load are composed of a variable price, a usage price and a fixed price analogous to the Costs. Prices are only needed if the Flexible Load is to be actively offered on the market.
Variable price refer to the total amount of energy converted.
Usage price are incurred per use of a Flexible-Load.
Fixed price
Meter point designation for the geographical and power grid topological location of a Flexible Load.
The unambiguous allocation is made by means of the meter point designation known in the energy industry / in market communication. In Germany, it corresponds to a 33-digit alphanumeric code number.

The specification of the Grid Voltage Level to which the Flexible Load is connected. The voltage level at the grid connection point is to be used, independent of deviating voltage levels in any company grid.
Storages may contain multiple storages, each of which represents a technical system or a combination of systems that has the potential to store energy
A storage represents a technical system or a combination of systems that has the potential to store energy

The ID of a storage for unique identification. The Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) is generated automatically and is used for identification and assignment within an IT system in a company and for further processing by external, market-side services.

The costs associated with the use of the energy storage. The Costs of a storage facility consist of variable cost, usage cost and fixed cost. Variable costs refer to the total amount of energy converted. Usage costs arise per use of a storage tank. Fixed costs arise from keeping a storage facility on standby.
Variable costs refer to the total amount of energy converted.
Usage costs arise per use of a storage tank.
Fixed costs arise from keeping a storage facility on standby.

Lower and upper limit of the storage energy content. These limits must never be exceeded or fallen short of. Depending on the choice of reference point, it is also possible to specify negative storage capacities, e.g. if it needs to be possible to either exceed or fall below storage limits.

Energy content of the storage at the start time of the Validity Period of the associated Flexible Load (Suppliers). If the storage is connected to several Flexible Loads, the Initial Energy Content refers to the earliest start time of the Validity Periods of all Flexible Loads. If the initial energy content cannot be quantified exactly, the predicted range can be specified via min and max.

Energy content that the storage must have at the end time of the Validity Period of the associated Flexible Loads (Suppliers). If the storage is connected to several Flexible Loads, the Target Energy Content refers to the latest end time of the Validity Periods of all Flexible Loads. If the target energy content is flexible, the desired target range is specified can be specified via min and max.
Proportion of the energy content that is continuously lost, e.g. through exchange with the environment. The percentage refers to the actual energy content and not to the storage capacity.
One or more Flexible Loads supplying the storage. The Flexible Loads must be defined in the same Flexibility Space. The conversion efficiency is specified for each supply system.
Indicating a single supply

This ID identifies the Flexible Load supplying the storage. The ID of a Flexible Load for unique identification. The Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) is generated automatically and is used for identification and assignment within an IT system in a company and for further processing by external, market-side services.
Energy conversion efficiency of the suppiler
Non-influenceable energy demands in the form of a load profile that must be met. The interpolation between the Power States is linear.
Indicating a single non-influenceable energy demand

timestamp of power drain

dependenciesmay contain multiple dependencies, each of which can be used to describe a restriction or dependency for the interaction of several Flexible Loads within an Flexibility Space. This allows the permissible operating options of an overall system to be mapped in greater detail so that Flexible-Load Measures do not have a negative impact on the system, the production processes or the product quality.

Each dependency can be used to describe a restriction or dependency for the interaction of several Flexible Loads within an Flexibility Space. This allows the permissible operating options of an overall system to be mapped in greater detail so that Flexible-Load Measures do not have a negative impact on the system, the production processes or the product quality.
The ID of a dependency for unique identification.

The time period following the activation of theTriggering Flexible-Load during which the Target Flexible-Load must be activated at least once (Logical Type: implies) or must not be activated at all (Logical Type: excludes). The values specified for min and max define the Applicability duration relative to:

Additional conditions that must be met for the dependency to be considered fulfilled. In other words, an activation of the Triggering Flexible-Load implies or excludes a corresponding activation of the Target Flexible-Load in a configuration (measure), so that the applicability conditions are fulfilled. The Triggering Flexible-Load metrics are incorporated on the left side of the formula. The Target Flexible-Load metrics are incorporated on the right side.
Indicating a single condition
enum: equals, less, lessEqual, greater, greaterEqual.
The Target Flexible-Load metrics are incorporated on the right side.
The Triggering Flexible-Load metrics are incorporated on the left side of the formula.

The Flexible Load that triggers the dependency. The Flexible Load must be defined in the same Flexibility Space, and is referenced by its ID. In addition, one time parameter (start, total or end) of the Triggering Flexible-Load affected by the dependency is to be indicated.

enum: start, total, end. The temporalType start specifies that with the activation of a Flexible-Load Measure belonging to this Flexible Load, the dependency Applicability Duration" of the Target Flexible-Load begins.  end specifies that at the deactivation end of a Flexible-Load Measure belonging to this Flexible Load, the dependency Appicability Duration of the "Target Flexible-Load begins.  total specifies that during a Flexible-Load Measure belonging to this Flexible Load, the dependency Applicability Duration of the Target Flexible-Load is valid.
The ID of the Flexible Load that is affected by the Triggering Flexible-Load. The Flexible Load must be defined in the same Flexibility Space, and is referenced by its ID.
target flexible load

enum: start, total, end. The temporalType start specifies that the start of a Flexible-Load Measure of the Target Flexible-Load is affected by the dependency Applicability Duration. end specifies that the deactivation end of a Flexible-Load Measure of the Target Flexible-Load is affected by the dependency Applicability Duration. total specifies that the Flexible-Load Measure of the Target Flexible-Load is affected by the dependency Applicability Duration starting at activation until the end of deactivation
UUID of the Flexible Load that is affected by the Triggering Flexible-Load. The Flexible Load must be defined in the same Flexibility Space, and is referenced by its ID.

enum: implies, excludes. Specifies whether a use of the Triggering Flexible-Load requires (implies) or prevents (excludes) the activation of the Target Flexible-Load within the Applicability Duration.

This SMC describes the degrees of freedom of an energy-flexible system based solely on its general technical characteristics. It focuses on the inherent flexibility potential of the system, independent of any operational strategies, specific conditions, or application-related constraints.
The metadata provides essential information for tracking and tracing of the model instances.
The ID of a Flexibility Space or Flexible-Load Measure Package for unique identification
Free text to comment the EFDM object.
Specification of the EFDM version and hyperlink to the corresponding scheme.
the EFDM version (e.g. 0.3)
hyperlink to the corresponding scheme

Containing UUID of the creating service and point in time of creation. By means of the automated filling in of the Element, conclusions about the origin and an allocation to executing agencies are made possible. In the case of communication with external services, this Element is replaced by an ID that is intended for external communication.
UUID of the creating service and point in time of creation
timestamp of the creating service

Containing UUID of the service instance that last processed this object and point in time of last processing. In the case of communication with external services, this Element can be replaced by an ID that is intended for external communication.
UUID of the service instance that last processed this object
timestamp of of last processing
Containing metainformation, describing the model status and scope
Status of the model instance in case of generalTechnicalPotential should be "draft"

generalTechnicalPotential: modelling of flexibility includes universally valid technical characteristics and restrictions. The model does not contain information on operational strategies, production plans, or other limitations arising from the specific use of the plant or system. In this case, the energy flexibility potential is not directly implementable.
flexibleLoads may contain multiple flexibleLoad.

Each flexibleLoad describes the energy flexibility of a technical system (i.e. controllable unit) or a combination of systems (i.e. an ensemble of controllable units) that can adjust its power consumption or generation in response to external conditions or requirements. It focuses on the limitations and possibilities (degrees of freedom) of changing power outputs of a technical system.

The ID of a Flexible Load for unique identification. The Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) is generated automatically and is used for identification and assignment within an IT system in a company and for further processing by external, market-side services. String Format: UUID

Time (seconds) required by a technical system between the receipt of a call-up and the initiation of a Flexible-Load Measure within the enterprise. The call must be issued with at least this lead time before the Flexible-Load Measure starts.

The required regeneration time during which no other measure of the same Flexible Load may be activated following the deactivation of a previous measure. This time constraint applies only if an actual deactivation occurs. If another measure follows without interruption, no deactivation takes place between them; this does not constitute a violation of the defined regerneration period.
The absolute value of the power gradient of a Flexible Load indicates how fast the power can be increased or decreased.
Actication Gradient specifies the power gradient applicable during the initial activation of the Flexibl Load.
Modulation Gradient specifies the power gradient during transitions between Power States.
Deactivation Gradient specifies the power gradient during the final deactivation phase

The maximum number of Power State changes (modulations) allowed within one use of a Flexible Load. The two modulations corresponding to the initial activation and the final deactivation are not counted.
a set of Power States with which the Flexible Load can run during each of the (number of changes + 1) holding periods.
A power state with which the Flexible Load can run during the corresponding holding periods.

A positive sign means that the Flexible Load can increase its power consumption. Negative Power States represent a possible decrease in power consumption. Uncertainty can be represented by specifying a range.
Storages may contain multiple storages, each of which represents a technical system or a combination of systems that has the potential to store energy
A storage represents a technical system or a combination of systems that has the potential to store energy

The ID of a storage for unique identification. The Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) is generated automatically and is used for identification and assignment within an IT system in a company and for further processing by external, market-side services.

Lower and upper limit of the storage energy content. These limits must never be exceeded or fallen short of. Depending on the choice of reference point, it is also possible to specify negative storage capacities, e.g. if it needs to be possible to either exceed or fall below storage limits.

Energy content of the storage at the start time of the Validity Period of the associated Flexible Load (Suppliers). If the storage is connected to several Flexible Loads, the Initial Energy Content refers to the earliest start time of the Validity Periods of all Flexible Loads. If the initial energy content cannot be quantified exactly, the predicted range can be specified via min and max.
Proportion of the energy content that is continuously lost, e.g. through exchange with the environment. The percentage refers to the actual energy content and not to the storage capacity.
One or more Flexible Loads supplying the storage. The Flexible Loads must be defined in the same Flexibility Space. The conversion efficiency is specified for each supply system.
Indicating a single supply

This ID identifies the Flexible Load supplying the storage. The ID of a Flexible Load for unique identification. The Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) is generated automatically and is used for identification and assignment within an IT system in a company and for further processing by external, market-side services.
Energy conversion efficiency of the suppiler
The flexibleLoadMeasureExecutionLog contains one or more Execution Log-Entry that records an implemented flexible load measure.
The metadata provides essential information for tracking and tracing of the model instances.
The ID of a Flexibility Space or Flexible-Load Measure Package for unique identification
Free text to comment the EFDM object.
Specification of the EFDM version and hyperlink to the corresponding scheme.
the EFDM version (e.g. 0.3)
hyperlink to the corresponding scheme

Containing UUID of the creating service and point in time of creation. By means of the automated filling in of the Element, conclusions about the origin and an allocation to executing agencies are made possible. In the case of communication with external services, this Element is replaced by an ID that is intended for external communication.
UUID of the creating service and point in time of creation
timestamp of the creating service

Containing UUID of the service instance that last processed this object and point in time of last processing. In the case of communication with external services, this Element can be replaced by an ID that is intended for external communication.
UUID of the service instance that last processed this object
timestamp of of last processing
executionLogEntries contains one or more executionLogEntry, each of which describes an implemented flexibleLoadMeasure.
Each executionLogEntry describes an implemented flexibleLoadMeasure.
The ID of the Flexible-Load Measure for which the log entry is created.

Realized revenue from implementing the Flexible-Load Measure. The sign indicates the direction of the cash flow, while the referencePoint specifies whether the value represents a cost saving or the total amount.
Error objects that occurred during the execution of the Flexible-Load Measure.
Load profiles that record the actual power reduction or increase of the Flexible load during execution. The Power values are refer to the same referencePoint as the associated Flexible-Load Measure.
A single Load profile that records the actual power reduction or increase of the Flexible load during execution.

Positive power states mean that the Flexible-Load Measure requests an increase in power consumption from the Flexible Load. Negative power states require a decrease in power consumption. Interpolation between Power States is linear; a step change in power can be mapped by specifying two equal timestamps with different power values.
timestamp of a power state
Refers to the associated Flexible-Load Measure as planed value
Each SMC flexibilitySpace describes the degrees of freedom of an energy-flexible system

description.text: The flexibleLoadMeasuresPackage contains one or more Flexible-Load Measures that describe a specific change in the performance of a dedicated Flexible Load

definition.text: The flexibleLoadMeasuresPackage contains one or more Flexible-Load Measures that describe a specific change in the performance of a dedicated Flexible Load

description.text: The metadata provides essential information for tracking and tracing of the model instances.

definition.text: The metadata provides essential information for tracking and tracing of the model instances.

A Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) is a 128-bit label used for information in computer systems.UUIDs are documented as part of ISO/IEC 11578:1996 "Information technology  Open Systems Interconnection  Remote Procedure Call (RPC)" and more recently in ITU-T Rec. X.667 | ISO/IEC 9834-8:2014.

mark attributed to an instant by means of a specified timescale, expressed as a date and a time. The format is defined in ISO 8601.

description.text: flexibleLoadMeasures may contain multiple flexibleLoadMeasure.

definition.text: flexibleLoadMeasuresmay contain multiple flexibleLoadMeasure.

description.text: flexibleLoad describes the energy flexibility of a technical system (i.e. controllable unit) or a combination of systems (i.e. an ensemble of controllable units) that can adjust its power consumption or generation in response to external conditions or requirements. It focuses on the limitations and possibilities (degrees of freedom) of changing power outputs of a technical system.

definition.text: flexibleLoad describes the energy flexibility of a technical system (i.e. controllable unit) or a combination of systems (i.e. an ensemble of controllable units) that can adjust its power consumption or generation in response to external conditions or requirements. It focuses on the limitations and possibilities (degrees of freedom) of changing power outputs of a technical system.

description.text: enum: draft, toExecute, inExecution, executed, partiallyExecuted, failed, and canceled. The status of a Flexible-Load Measure indicates its current progress within the process of providing energy flexiblity. The goal is to enable clear tracking of each measure across defined phases:

definition.text: status of the model instance.

description.text: Total revenue received by a company for executing the Flexible-Load Measure.

definition.text: Total revenue received by a company for executing the Flexible-Load Measure.

description.text: loadChangeProfiles may contain multiple loadChangeProfile.

definition.text: loadChangeProfiles may contain multiple loadChangeProfile.

description.text: Load profile that represents the power reduction or increase of the Flexible Load.

definition.text: Load profile that represents the power reduction or increase of the Flexible Load.
electrical power consumption of the component or system

description.text: Containing metainformation, describing the model status and scope

definition.text: Containing metainformation, describing the model status and scope

description.text: enum: generalTechnicalPotential, operationalPotential, applicationTailoredPotential. The modelling scope places individual EFDM instances and their key figures into context. generalTechnicalPotential: The modelling of flexibility includes universally valid technical characteristics and restrictions; the model does not contain operational strategies, production plans, or other plant-specific limitations. The energy flexibility potential is not directly implementable. operationalPotential: Flexibility is fully considered within the production environment; the model describes the maximum feasible potential, independent of the specific use case. applicationTailoredPotential: The model describes a potential tailored to a specific application (e.g. energy market may allow only Flexible Load with 15-min holding durations); storage and dependencies may need to be transformed to be represented as Flexible Load.

definition.text: enum: generalTechnicalPotential, operationalPotential, applicationTailoredPotential. The modelling scope places individual EFDM instances and their key figures into context. generalTechnicalPotential: The modelling of flexibility includes universally valid technical characteristics and restrictions; the model does not contain operational strategies, production plans, or other plant-specific limitations. The energy flexibility potential is not directly implementable. operationalPotential: Flexibility is fully considered within the production environment; the model describes the maximum feasible potential, independent of the specific use case. applicationTailoredPotential: The model describes a potential tailored to a specific application (e.g. energy market may allow only Flexible Load with 15-min holding durations); storage and dependencies may need to be transformed to be represented as Flexible Load.

description.text: The Trading of a Flexibility Space comprises configurable properties that determine its feasibility and operational implementation

definition.text: The Trading of a Flexibility Space comprises configurable properties that determine its feasibility and operational implementation

description.text: Indicates whether the Flexibility Space is intended to participate in external energy markets (true) or is to be used exclusively for internal optimization purposes (false).

definition.text: Indicates whether the Flexibility Space is intended to participate in external energy markets (true) or is to be used exclusively for internal optimization purposes (false).

description.text: Specifies whether the trading process can be executed automatically (true) or if additional manual preparations or reviews and verification procedures are required (false).

definition.text: Specifies whether the trading process can be executed automatically (true) or if additional manual preparations or reviews and verification procedures are required (false).

description.text: flexibleLoads may contain multiple flexibleLoad. Each flexibleLoad describes the energy flexibility of a technical system (i.e. controllable unit) or a combination of systems (i.e. an ensemble of controllable units) that can adjust its power consumption or generation in response to external conditions or requirements. It focuses on the limitations and possibilities (degrees of freedom) of changing power outputs of a technical system.

definition.text: flexibleLoads may contain multiple flexibleLoad. Each flexibleLoad describes the energy flexibility of a technical system (i.e. controllable unit) or a combination of systems (i.e. an ensemble of controllable units) that can adjust its power consumption or generation in response to external conditions or requirements. It focuses on the limitations and possibilities (degrees of freedom) of changing power outputs of a technical system.
response time

description.text: Subset of the company-internal planning horizon in which the Flexible Load is available. The beginning and end of this validity period are specified with the attributes from and until. If this period is not specified, continuous availability of the Flexible Load is assumed.

definition.text: Subset of the company-internal planning horizon in which the Flexible Load is available. The beginning and end of this validity period are specified with the attributes from and until. If this period is not specified, continuous availability of the Flexible Load is assumed.

description.text: enum: start, total, end. The temporalType start specifies that the start time must lie within the period. end specifies that the end time must lie within the Period. total specifies that the total duration must lie within the Period.

definition.text: enum: start, total, end. The temporalType start specifies that the start of an activity must lie within the period. end specifies that the end of an activity must lie within the period. total specifies that the total duration of an activity must lie within the period.

description.text: a set of Power States with which the Flexible Load can run during each of the (number of changes + 1) holding periods.

definition.text: a set of Power States with which the Flexible Load can run during each of the (number of changes + 1) holding periods.
range of a time interval

description.text: enum: deliveryDuration, holdingDuration. Duration either corresponds to the time of a constant Power State (holdingDuration) OR a constant Power State WITH initial power modulation (deliveryDuration).

definition.text: enum: deliveryDuration, holdingDuration. Duration either corresponds to the time of a constant Power State (holdingDuration) OR a constant Power State WITH initial power modulation (deliveryDuration).

description.text: The permitted number of activations of the Flexible Load within the Validity Period. A specified minimum value of the range defines a required number of activations; a specified maximum value sets an upper limit on activation frequency.
Its value should be populated by service provider

definition.text: The permitted number of activations of the Flexible Load within the Validity Period. A specified minimum value of the range defines a required number of activations; a specified maximum value sets an upper limit on activation frequency.

description.text: The maximum number of Power State changes (modulations) allowed within one use of a Flexible Load. The two modulations corresponding to the initial activation and the final deactivation are not counted.

definition.text: The maximum number of Power State changes (modulations) allowed within one use of a Flexible Load. The two modulations corresponding to the initial activation and the final deactivation are not counted.

description.text: The absolute value of the power gradient of a Flexible Load indicates how fast the power can be increased or decreased.

definition.text: The absolute value of the power gradient of a Flexible Load indicates how fast the power can be increased or decreased.
the gradient of power cunsumption

description.text: The costs associated with the use of the Flexible Load, excluding electricity costs. The Costs of a Flexible Load consist of variable cost, usage cost and fixed cost.

definition.text: The costs associated with the use of the Flexible Load, excluding electricity costs. The Costs of a Flexible Load consist of variable cost, usage cost and fixed cost.

description.text: Variable costs refer to the total amount of energy converted.

definition.text: Costs in Euro per total amount of energy converted.

description.text: Usage costs are incurred per use

definition.text: Costs per usage

description.text: Fixed costs

definition.text: Fixed cost in Euro

description.text: Latest possible time by which confirmation of an accepted offer of the Flexible Load must have been received. By this time, the flexibility provider needs to know whether the Flexible Load must be held ready. After the Booking Confirmation Deadline is exceeded, the Flexible Load offer is removed from the market. The Order Confirmation Deadline can be specified EITHER absolutely with a fixed time OR relative to the start time of the Flexible-Load Measure (e.g. 100 seconds before the start of a FLM). If no value is specified, constant availability for offering is assumed until the latest possible start time within the Validity Period minus the Reaction Duration.

definition.text: Latest possible time by which confirmation of an accepted offer of the Flexible Load must have been received. By this time, the flexibility provider needs to know whether the Flexible Load must be held ready. After the Booking Confirmation Deadline is exceeded, the Flexible Load offer is removed from the market. The Order Confirmation Deadline can be specified EITHER absolutely with a fixed time OR relative to the start time of the Flexible-Load Measure (e.g. 100 seconds before the start of a FLM). If no value is specified, constant availability for offering is assumed until the latest possible start time within the Validity Period minus the Reaction Duration.

description.text: Prices to be realized on the market as a minimum for offering the Flexible Load. The Prices of a Flexible Load are composed of a variable price, a usage price and a fixed price analogous to the Costs. Prices are only needed if the Flexible Load is to be actively offered on the market.

definition.text: Prices to be realized on the market as a minimum for offering the Flexible Load. The Prices of a Flexible Load are composed of a variable price, a usage price and a fixed price analogous to the Costs. Prices are only needed if the Flexible Load is to be actively offered on the market.

description.text: Variable price refer to the total amount of energy converted.

definition.text: Variable price refer to the total amount of energy converted.

description.text: Usage price are incurred per use of a Flexible-Load.

definition.text: price per usage

description.text: Fixed price

definition.text: fixed price

description.text: Meter point designation for the geographical and power grid topological location of a Flexible Load.

definition.text: Meter point designation for the geographical and power grid topological location of a Flexible Load.
The meter point designation identifies clearly the location of the point of consumption.
The voltage level at the grid connection point is to be used, independent of deviating voltage levels in any company grid.

description.text: Storages may contain multiple storages, each of which represents a technical system or a combination of systems that has the potential to store energy

definition.text: Storages may contain multiple storages, each of which represents a technical system or a combination of systems that has the potential to store energy

description.text: A storage represents a technical system or a combination of systems that has the potential to store energy

definition.text: A storage represents a technical system or a combination of systems that has the potential to store energy

description.text: The costs associated with the use of the energy storage. The Costs of a storage facility consist of variable cost, usage cost and fixed cost. Variable costs refer to the total amount of energy converted. Usage costs arise per use of a storage tank. Fixed costs arise from keeping a storage facility on standby.

definition.text: The costs associated with the use of the energy storage. The Costs of a storage facility consist of variable cost, usage cost and fixed cost. Variable costs refer to the total amount of energy converted. Usage costs arise per use of a storage tank. Fixed costs arise from keeping a storage facility on standby.
electrical energy content of the storage
Proportion of the energy content that is continuously lost

description.text: One or more Flexible Loads supplying the storage. The Flexible Loads must be defined in the same Flexibility Space. The conversion efficiency is specified for each supply system.

definition.text: One or more Flexible Loads supplying the storage. The Flexible Loads must be defined in the same Flexibility Space. The conversion efficiency is specified for each supply system.

description.text: Indicating a single supply

definition.text: Indicating a single supply

the ratio between the useful output of an energy conversion machine and the input, in energy terms. The input, as well as the useful output may be chemical, electric power, mechanical work, light (radiation), or heat. The resulting value,  (eta), ranges between 0% and 100%.

description.text: dependenciesmay contain multiple dependencies, each of which can be used to describe a restriction or dependency for the interaction of several Flexible Loads within an Flexibility Space. This allows the permissible operating options of an overall system to be mapped in greater detail so that Flexible-Load Measures do not have a negative impact on the system, the production processes or the product quality.

definition.text: dependenciesmay contain multiple dependencies, each of which can be used to describe a restriction or dependency for the interaction of several Flexible Loads within an Flexibility Space. This allows the permissible operating options of an overall system to be mapped in greater detail so that Flexible-Load Measures do not have a negative impact on the system, the production processes or the product quality.

description.text: Each dependency can be used to describe a restriction or dependency for the interaction of several Flexible Loads within an Flexibility Space. This allows the permissible operating options of an overall system to be mapped in greater detail so that Flexible-Load Measures do not have a negative impact on the system, the production processes or the product quality.

definition.text: Each dependency can be used to describe a restriction or dependency for the interaction of several Flexible Loads within an Flexibility Space. This allows the permissible operating options of an overall system to be mapped in greater detail so that Flexible-Load Measures do not have a negative impact on the system, the production processes or the product quality.

description.text: Additional conditions that must be met for the dependency to be considered fulfilled. In other words, an activation of the Triggering Flexible-Load implies or excludes a corresponding activation of the Target Flexible-Load in a configuration (measure), so that the applicability conditions are fulfilled. The Triggering Flexible-Load metrics are incorporated on the left side of the formula. The Target Flexible-Load metrics are incorporated on the right side.

definition.text: Additional conditions that must be met for the dependency to be considered fulfilled. In other words, an activation of the Triggering Flexible-Load implies or excludes a corresponding activation of the Target Flexible-Load in a configuration (measure), so that the applicability conditions are fulfilled. The Triggering Flexible-Load metrics are incorporated on the left side of the formula. The Target Flexible-Load metrics are incorporated on the right side.

description.text: Indicating a single condition

definition.text: a single applicability condition of the corresponding dependency

description.text: enum: equals, less, lessEqual, greater, greaterEqual.

definition.text: enum: equals, less, lessEqual, greater, greaterEqual.

description.text: The Target Flexible-Load metrics are incorporated on the right side.

definition.text: The Target Flexible-Load metrics are incorporated on the right side.

description.text: The Triggering Flexible-Load metrics are incorporated on the left side of the formula.

definition.text: The Triggering Flexible-Load metrics are incorporated on the left side of the formula.

description.text: The Flexible Load that triggers the dependency. The Flexible Load must be defined in the same Flexibility Space, and is referenced by its ID. In addition, one time parameter (start, total or end) of the Triggering Flexible-Load affected by the dependency is to be indicated.

definition.text: The Flexible Load that triggers the dependency. The Flexible Load must be defined in the same Flexibility Space, and is referenced by its ID. In addition, one time parameter (start, total or end) of the Triggering Flexible-Load affected by the dependency is to be indicated.

description.text: enum: implies, excludes. Specifies whether a use of the Triggering Flexible-Load requires (implies) or prevents (excludes) the activation of the Target Flexible-Load within the Applicability Duration.

definition.text: enum: implies, excludes. Specifies whether a use of the Triggering Flexible-Load requires (implies) or prevents (excludes) the activation of the Target Flexible-Load within the Applicability Duration.

description.text: Each SMC flexibilitySpace describes the degrees of freedom of an energy-flexible system

definition.text: flexibility space application tailored potential

description.text: A flexibilitySpace describes the degrees of freedom of an energy-flexible system. In this SMC, it concerns the general technical flexibility potential of the system, regardless operational or other specific conditions and limitations.

definition.text: A flexibilitySpace describes the degrees of freedom of an energy-flexible system. In this SMC, it concerns the general technical flexibility potential of the system, regardless operational or other specific conditions and limitations.

description.text: The flexibleLoadMeasureExecutionLog contains one or more Execution Log-Entry that records an implemented flexible load measure.

definition.text: The flexibleLoadMeasureExecutionLog contains one or more Execution Log-Entry that records an implemented flexible load measure.

description.text: executionLogEntries contains one or more executionLogEntry, each of which describes an implemented flexibleLoadMeasure.

definition.text: executionLogEntries contains one or more executionLogEntry, each of which describes an implemented flexibleLoadMeasure.

description.text: Each executionLogEntry describes an implemented flexibleLoadMeasure.

definition.text: Each executionLogEntry describes an implemented flexibleLoadMeasure.

description.text: Error objects that occurred during the execution of the Flexible-Load Measure.

definition.text: Error objects that occurred during the execution of the Flexible-Load Measure.

description.text: Refers to the associated Flexible-Load Measure as planed value

definition.text: Refers to the associated Flexible-Load Measure as planed value

description.text: Non-influenceable energy demands in the form of a load profile that must be met. The interpolation between the Power States is linear.

definition.text: Non-influenceable energy demands in the form of a load profile that must be met. The interpolation between the Power States is linear.
